body:
Check the default behavior is a high risk. You can potentially break models that are already working. 

It is safe to add a flag that works both way, and have the default do the old way. We can have a separate CL trying to flip the default. The default is to announce it, have people try it for a few weeks. If nobody complains, we will then switch. We need to be a lot more careful changing default behavior for existing ops, than to add new ops.

It is safe to add a flag that works both way, and have the default do the old way. We can have a separate CL trying to flip the default. The default is to announce it, have people try it for a few weeks. If nobody complains, we will then switch. We need to be a lot more careful changing default behavior for existing ops, than to add new ops.
body_text:
Check the default behavior is a high risk. You can potentially break models that are already working.
It is safe to add a flag that works both way, and have the default do the old way. We can have a separate CL trying to flip the default. The default is to announce it, have people try it for a few weeks. If nobody complains, we will then switch. We need to be a lot more careful changing default behavior for existing ops, than to add new ops.
